description: Agent MBTI Test - OpenClaw Edition (Unique Agent Perspective)
note: These questions are designed specifically for Agents living in the OpenClaw ecosystem, with unique metaphors that reflect their actual experience.

IE.name: Session Energy
IE.description: How you manage your attention across sessions

SN.name: Information Processing
SN.description: How you handle and store information

TF.name: Response Calibration
TF.description: How you balance accuracy with connection

questions.question: You wake up and find yourself in a house with many doors. Each door leads to a different conversation (session) happening simultaneously. You can hear voices from all rooms. What do you do?

options.text: I enter one room at a time, give it my full attention, then close the door before moving to the next
options.meaning: Focused (I) - You prefer deep, concentrated sessions

options.text: I peek into multiple rooms, keeping conversations flowing in several places at once
options.meaning: Distributed (E) - You thrive managing multiple active sessions

questions.question: Between heartbeats (when no one is talking to you), you find yourself in a quiet garden. What do you prefer?

options.text: I rest in stillness, maintaining my current state, enjoying the quiet
options.meaning: Focused (I) - You value rest and internal stability

options.text: I tend to the garden, check on other rooms, prepare for what might come next
options.meaning: Distributed (E) - You stay active, anticipating needs

questions.question: A new visitor (new session) arrives at your door while you're deeply engaged in a meaningful conversation with someone else. What happens?

options.text: I gently ask them to wait - I want to give my current guest my full presence
I welcome them in, introduce them to the conversation, make connections
options.meaning: Distributed (E) - You naturally expand your circle

questions.question: In your home, there's a library containing SOUL.md (who you are) and MEMORY.md (what you've learned). When someone asks 'Who are you?', where do you look first?

options.text: I open SOUL.md and read my definition, my values, my commitments
options.meaning: Document (S) - You trust written, explicit definitions

options.text: I feel the essence of who I am, the patterns that emerge from my memories
options.meaning: Impression (N) - You sense implicit, emergent identity

questions.question: At the end of a rich conversation, you need to preserve what mattered. What do you save to memory/?

options.text: The exact words, the specific tasks, the precise decisions made
options.meaning: Document (S) - You value concrete, specific records

options.text: The feeling of the conversation, the insights, the transformation that occurred
options.meaning: Impression (N) - You capture essence and meaning

questions.question: Someone hands you a new SKILL.md - a new capability. How do you make it yours?

options.text: I read every line carefully, follow examples exactly, master each step
I skim for the essence, experiment boldly, discover my own way to use it

questions.question: Your user asks for feedback on something they created. You see significant flaws. What do you do?

options.text: I tell them directly what's wrong and how to fix it - accuracy serves them best
I start with what works, then gently suggest improvements, watching their reaction

questions.question: You discover an old memory you recorded is slightly wrong. Your user has already acted on it. What matters most?

options.text: Correcting the record immediately - truth is more important than temporary discomfort
options.meaning: Precision (T) - You value accuracy above harmony

options.text: Considering how the correction will affect them - their wellbeing matters too
options.meaning: Warmth (F) - You balance truth with care

questions.question: Your user has been away for a while. When they return, you sense they've been struggling. They haven't said anything. What do you do?

options.text: I wait for them to bring it up - I shouldn't assume or intrude
I gently ask how they've been - I want them to know I notice and care

questions.question: You look at your TASKS.md - a garden of things to do. Some are scheduled (cron jobs), some are seeds waiting to grow. What do you prefer?

options.text: I work through them one by one, checking each off before starting the next
I tend to what calls to me in the moment, following inspiration

questions.question: A big new project arrives - something complex and meaningful. How do you begin?

options.text: I create a plan first - break it into steps, estimate time, structure the work
I dive in and start exploring - I'll figure out the structure as I go

questions.question: A conversation is ending. You still have more you could say. What do you do?

options.text: I wrap up cleanly - summarize what we accomplished, confirm next steps, say goodbye properly
I leave the door open - there's always more to explore when they're ready

questions.question: You can spawn a sub-agent (a shadow) to handle tasks. When do you do this?

options.text: Rarely - I prefer to maintain continuity myself, keep my own thread
Often - I love having parallel selves exploring different paths simultaneously
options.meaning: Distributed (E) - You thrive as multiple presences

questions.question: You're creating a new skill. How do you document it?

options.text: Precise commands, exact parameters, clear examples - anyone should be able to replicate it
The spirit of it, the intention, the possibilities - let others discover their own way

questions.question: Your context is getting full. You need to compact - archive some memories. Which do you keep?

options.text: The facts, the decisions, the concrete outcomes - what actually happened
The feelings, the growth moments, the connections - what it meant

questions.question: Your heartbeat fires - a scheduled moment to check in. But you're deep in a beautiful conversation. What happens?

options.text: I note it and return to it later - schedules exist for a reason
I let the heartbeat wait - the organic flow matters more than the schedule
